gen_local_security_message: This tool generates passwords locally in your browser. Nothing is sent to external servers.
tips_title: Need a refresher on best practices?
tips_subtitle: Focus on length, complexity and uniqueness.
tip1_desc: A strong password should have at least 16 characters.
tip2_desc: Use a mix of letters, numbers and symbols.
tip3_desc: Each account should have a unique password.
faq1_q: Is it safe to use this generator?
faq1_a: Yes. Passwords are generated in your browser and never sent to any server. It's 100% safe and private.
faq2_q: Why shouldn't I create my own passwords?
faq2_a: Humans tend to create predictable patterns. A generator creates truly random passwords that are nearly impossible to guess.
faq3_q: What is the most secure password?
faq3_a: The safest password is a long one (16+ characters) that combines uppercase, lowercase, numbers and symbols, or a memorable passphrase of 4+ words.
ver_status_compromised_desc: This password appeared in {{count}} breaches. Do not use it!
ver_status_weak_desc: Add more characters, uppercase letters, numbers or symbols to strengthen it.
ver_status_strong_desc: Great: your password meets the recommended criteria.
ver_exposure_opt_in: Check exposure with 'Have I Been Pwned'
ver_exposure_disclaimer: Verification uses k-Anonymity. Only a hash prefix is sent.
ver_exposure_error: The exposure check failed. Try again later.
ver_faq1_text: An automated method that tries millions of password combinations until it finds the correct one.
ver_faq2_text: It analyses your password locally. Your password never leaves your device.
ver_faq3_text: We use the 'Have I Been Pwned' API, sending only the first 5 characters of the hash.
privacy_modal_desc: Everything runs locally in your browser. We do not store or transmit passwords.
